description: Convertible, great body, nice new slick paint, nice redone int, good orig top, well kept, 72,xxx actual miles, new fuel pump, full tune up, 4cyl, 5spd, power disc brakes, pw, a/c, new tires, fun little car, runs/drives great
California car since day one, single family owned for past 25 years, original engine, very nice.
THE VEHICLE OFFERED

Not all classic cars are equal. Some struggle to start, others rattle at any slight bump in the road. But when you come across a car, held by a single owner, for any significant amount of time, those examples just feel better in every single way. This Alfa Romeo, not only is a rust free example, has lived in California its entire life, and is a believed to be two owner car. Being sold new in San Jose, CA the car traded hands just once 25 years ago and has resided in the Bay Area. It has always been cared for and that shows from the paint, to the interior, to the excellent mechanical condition. This car never hesitates to start up, and holds and idle like new. The 1300 cc engine is the original unit and it wears its original Solex carburetor mated to the 4 speed transmission. Revving the engine and rowing through the gears is the highlight of this experience but the exterior body styled by Pininfarina holds pace. Seeing an older repaint over 20 years ago the paint shines extremely to this day. There are no cracks or fades. There are only 2 small areas of orange peel that are very hard to notice. The car has obviously always been garaged and it recently saw a light reconditioning thanks to a professional buff, polish, and wax for future protection. All of the exterior chrome and brightwork is in excellent condition. The lights function from the turn indicators to the period correct fog lights. The wheels and hub caps are original and correct to the car. New tires have been fitted for peace of mind. The interior is an excellent place to spend some time. There is nothing cooler than looking over the vintage steering wheel, down the gray hood and chrome hood spear while wrapped in a contrasting red vinyl cocoon. The carpets, door cards, dash, gauges, seats, floor mats, and steering wheel are in excellent condition. When the interior was refreshed years ago the soft top was never re-installed. The original frame will accompany the car while fabric will need to be fitted. This is a testament to the fact that the car was never driven in the ran and has been garage kept. A comforting fact for the serious buyer. The trunk presents very well too and shows no signs of corrosion in to common areas. This is one excellent driving experience and a true opportunity to possess a genuinely solid and highly collectable Alfa Romeo Giulietta Spider.
Additional photographs available upon request.
car in fair condition. sound body without passing rust. original interior preserved.

1966 Alfa Romeo Spider 1966 A.K.A Duetto For Sale in Urbana, Illinois 61802

If you are someone who appreciates a sophisticated yet sporty vehicle than look no further because this 1966 Alfa Romeo Spider 1966 A.K.A Duetto is perfect for you!  This two-door import feaures a sleek, muscular styling that is sure to turn heads. It is comes dressed to impress, with Red exterior paint complemented by an exceptionally clean black vinyl interior. Powered by a 4 Cylinder engine that is mated with a manual transmission, this handsome devil is mostly all original and is all numbers matching. In addition to its dynamic display of power and performance this handsome convertible is ready to provide an enjoyable open top driving experience. With only 6,799 original miles you can rest assured that this charming Duetto will inspire your love of classic cars for many years to come!

In 1966 Alfa Romeo produced what might in today's jargon be called the "Beta edition" of the Duetto. The first year's production was very limited and Alfa Romeo did not generally export it to the United States. Today the 1966 edition is rare in the United States and elsewhere. Purchased in 1976 in Vicenza Italy, this car listed is in very good condition. Finding a market value for this gem is difficult. Extrapolating from National Automobile Dealers Association data the asking price tops out at $140,000. Even if you aren't a collector of Alfa Romeos or Italian sports cars in general, you will want to consider owning this very special car.  It's a fun car to drive with a soft ride and easy handling.  It's a classic, a 50-year-old design that still looks good today.  The Alfa Romeo “Spider 1600” was introduced to the world on March 10th, 1966. The unofficial name for the first generation of this Italian classic is “Duetto”, implying a small car built for two.  The Duetto was a major change in design for Alfa Romeo, so in 1966 Alfa Romeo chose to hold their cards close to their vest and did not sell the Duetto in the United States. Americans had to wait till 1967 to get their hands on one.  After the Duetto made an appearance in the movie The Graduate it became very popular in the U.S.  This Alfa Romeo was number 700 off the line and you'll be hard pressed to find a Duetto built earlier.  Like the '64 Mustang the Duetto was the start of a line that lasted for decades. This 1966 Alfa Romeo comes with a plethora of options and features that are perfect for any true classic car enthusiast.
Highlights Of These Features Include:
New Front Disc Brakes
New Spark Plugs, Wiring And Timing Adjusted
Tires With Low Miles
Wheels Newly Painted
Radio/Cassette Player
New Convertible Top
Hard Top That Fastens In Using The Convertible Connections
Carpet Is Old But Not Original
Seats Where In The Car When Purchase But Unsure If They Are Original
Missing Minor Pieces Of Chrome And The Head Light Covers
And SO Much More !!!

This 1966 Alfa Romeo Spider 1966 A.K.A Duetto has never been restored, and has always been very well maintained. It is a must see/drive to truly appreciate everything it has to offer.  In fact, come see for yourself! You will be hard pressed to find another '66 Alfa Romeo Spider 1966 A.K.A Duetto in this condition for the asking price. Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity! Call today for more information on how you can get behind the wheel of this iconic classic gem!!!
1983 Alfa Romeo Veloce Spider For Sale!

For your consideration is a beautiful Alfa Romeo Veloce Spider.  With very low millage at 30,480, this Spider has many more memories to be had.  This Alfa Romeo is an inexpensive way to own and enjoy an Italian exotic.  This car runs, handles, steers and stops as you would hope from an Italian sports car.  The car is mechanically sound with just a few things that are not perfect.  The AC isnt currently blowing very cold air and the transmission will pop out of reverse if you dont hold the shiftier when backing up.  As with many of these cars, the emissions light comes on when the car is running.

When you drop the convertible top and drive down the road, this Veloce Spider may have you dreaming of driving through the Italian country side.  Or, city traffic.  With that said, this car doesn't overheat and runs as it should in city & highway driving.  This is a very enjoyable car with many new parts.  Some of the recent work is itemized below.
Fuel line sections replaced
Fresh PM/Chassis lube
Horn repaired
Fuel Pump
Clutch & Pressure plate
Many brake components

The cars interior is very nice for its age.  The top has been replaced and is newer, excellent shape.  Paint and exterior of the '83 Alfa Romeo is in good shape, very good for its age and does have some flaws.  Nothing out of the ordinary, see the photos.
The overall condition of the car is good.  It is a running and driving car that someone can enjoy and participate in car shows with.  This car has had the same adult owner for almost 30 years.

This 1967 Alfa Romeo Spider Duetto is finished in red over black and was reportedly acquired from its original owner in 2015 by the current owner, who is the proprietor of Alfa Center in San Francisco, California. A subsequent overhaul is said to have included a respray as well as rebuilds of its 1,600cc twin-cam four, 5-speed manual transmission, 4-wheel disc brakes, and more. The odometer shows approximately 49k miles, just 300 of which have been added since completion of the work. This Spider is offered by the seller on behalf of its owner with a top cover and a clean California title in the owner's name. *Expertly restored and tastefully upgraded example of the classic Giulietta Spider
*Brisk performance, handling and braking power
*Toured on the Holyland 1000 Tour of Israel, Marrakech and California Mille rallies
*Offered with restoration records and tonneau cover

You and I might cringe at a $90,000+ restoration bill, but when a Mercedes Benz 540K, a 1937 Alfa Romeo 2.9 Spider -that you bought from Ralph Lauren - and a 1937 Type 57SC Bugatti Atalante Coupe, are just a couple of the cars in your collection, a $100k restoration bill is getting off light.
We're told that the original owner of this Giulietta was a devoted Alfa enthusiast. He must have been as he kept the car an incredible 55 years.

The next owner was the collector noted above. He wanted to participate in some vintage rallies, but with something a bit less valuable than his serious iron. He found this California Giulietta and commissioned a cosmetic restoration and mechanical upgrade to bring the car up to the condition he was accustomed to.
The body was completely stripped and rotisserie restored. The interior was totally restored with new leather, carpet, and soft trim. The top was replaced and all chrome was restored or replaced.

Mechanically, the car needed to be reliable under any condition as well as run with the pack. A Weber carbed 2 liter Alfa engine was acquired to replace the anemic 1300, then rebuilt to better than new specs. The 4 speed transmission was abandoned in favor of a 5 speed. The chassis was treated to new bushings, new shocks and 4 wheel disc brakes.

The result was a rousing success with the car competing internationally in the 2014 Marrakech Tour, the California Mille Miglia, and the 2015 Holy Land Tour. Each event consisted of approximately 1,000 miles of strenuous driving through various weather conditions and geographical challenges, all completed without issue.
Looking to go rallying or just want a great Giulietta Spider for Cars and Coffee? We have you covered.

This 1969 Alfa Romeo GTV is being offered by the original owner, who has driven it only 25k miles since it was new. The car was kept in heated storage for the last 30 years until just one month ago, when it was given an oil change, new tires, a brake-booster rebuild, and new spark plugs to put it back on the road. The fendertop mirrors were added at delivery and an ANSA exhaust was fitted a few years after purchase, with the seller stating that the car is otherwise unmodified. The original 1750cc twin-cam four-cylinder and five-speed manual transmission remain in the car, and it is finished in Giallo Ocra (AR109). This 1969 GTV is being sold with a custom car cover, receipts for the recent refurbishment, and a clean Ontario title in the seller's name. This listing is live now, and only for 7 days, so take a look at the current bidding and live discussion here at
https://bringatrailer.com/listing/1969-alfa-romeo-gtv-15/
